body:
I’m a husband, a father, and a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. I work as a consultant for Pariveda Solutions.
The following are a few things I enjoy doing in my spare time at home that isn’t just enjoying family:
 thinking about new forms of government discussing philosophy & religion writing code in Rust, DotNet, Python, or JavaScript (What’s the point of other languages? Maybe I’d allow Haskell for academics and Prolog ) studying economics, management, and entrepreneurship  Sanchez Family Identity How we want the world to see us. How we want our friends to see us. How we want to see ourselves.  Love noun
 a profoundly tender, passionate affection for another person. a feeling of warm personal attachment or deep affection, as for a parent, child, or friend. the benevolent affection of God for His creatures, or the reverent affection due from them to God.  verb
 to have a profoundly tender, passionate affection for(another person). to need or require; benefit greatly from: Plants love sunlight.  Excellence noun
 The quality of being outstanding or extremely good An outstanding feature or quality  Humility noun
 The term “humility” comes from the Latin word humilitas, a noun related to the adjective humilis, which may be translated as “humble”, but also as “grounded” “Humility is not thinking less of yourself, it’s thinking of yourself less.” ― CS Lewis the quality or state of not thinking you are better than other people modesty, lacking pretence, not believing that you are superior to others . . . shun[ing] public adulation, and . . . never boastful  Integrity noun
 The state of being whole and undivided: “territorial integrity” The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles; moral uprightness  Joyful adjective
 Feeling, expressing, or causing great pleasure and happiness
title: About Me
